moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 c5 3. cxd5 Qxd5 4. Nf3 Nc: it is understandable that black remove the attack on his rook by Bf4, but leaving his back rank is the mistake that ultimately loses the game
moves.17. Qc8+: the only option for removing check is Qd8
moves.18... Qd7 19. Qxc5: black incurs heavy casualties - if white plays his cards right, this is essentially a won game
moves.19... Rb5 20. Qe3 Rxd5 21. Rd1 e6 22. O-: black creates too much "air" between his sentry pawns and the king
